intro: Erysimum vulgare, commonly known as common wallflower, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has simple, lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Erysimum vulgare is valued in gardens for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
